title: (x) Looking for TF Arrow - Treacyfaces {Yves}
content:
A client of mine uses TF Arrow as an identity font. They have a version purchased in 2000 that has no italics or small caps. Also, it is REALLY tightly spaced and dies at small sizes. Is Tracy faces still around? I am trying to contact them for EULA info about modification and to see if they have extended the family by now (or if they would let me do a set of small caps). I can’t find them. Anybody know if they live? or if the name is spelled wrong?

Chris

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414234116im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tfarrow_4705.png)

 [‹ Jack Daniels Package](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414234116/http:/typophile.com/node/30813 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Foti Cleaning Services fancy script - Polonaise ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414234116/http:/typophile.com/node/30902 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dezcom

comments.content:
Ya see, SPELLING really matters :-)

Thanks Yves!

ChrisL

Of course spelling matters. ;-)

And they’ve got a pretty complete set of italics. Didn’t see small caps though.

(Reasonable pricing and a nice EULA, too....)

O, zpeleen iz zoooo oberated. hoo kares avout zpeliin?

;-D

Ricardo, uoo maide migh dae :-)

ChrisL
